title.narrative: 4.2 EVIDENCE-BASED INCLUSIVE POLICIES

description.narrative: By 2017, regional governments have strengthened capacity to develop and update evidence-based policies and elaborate public budgets that take into account the rights of the most vulnerable children for social exclusion., which contributes to Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, adolescents who are most vulnerable to social exclusion, especially women gain spaces, opportunities and capacity to participate in their development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, regional governments have strengthened capacity to develop and update evidence-based policies and elaborate publicbudgets that take into account the rights of the most vulnerable children for social exclusion.
Number of private sector companies and other strategic partners involved in collaborative solutions for child rights

actual.value: 2014:At least 15 institutions involved in setting up an entrepreneurial ecosystem (American Institute of Architecture, Ashoka, UNIXOX, Garage Lab, TOI, TEDx Managua, Agora Partnerships, IEEP, CEP, FunLimon, Rancho Santana, Guacalito de la Isla, Mukul, EvoluzionChile, Buena Onda, Soma Surf Resort, Teonost

title.narrative: Number of innovative and/or alternative solutions to bottlenecks in service delivery proposed in participatory processes.

actual.value: 2014:On track. 5 themes for in-depth investigation identified during Design for Children initiative. 26 business opportunities identified that create value for children and responsible tourism (supporting 15 social enterprises).

title.narrative: Regional Policy for Indigenous Children revised using a Human Centered Design approach

target.value: 2015:RACN- policy developed RACS: Revised policy developed

actual.value: 2014:On track. Policy in RAAN pending approval following regional elections. Policy in RAAS ongoing as scheduled.

title.narrative: Monitoring mechanism (observatories) strengthened and operationalized to follow up the results and impacts of the implementation of the regional policy for children in RAAN and RAAS

baseline.value: observatories exist in BICU but not fully functional little focus on child rights
